resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
It does not matter what I do, I just cannot import *pyarrow* module in Python without this error message: *"ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified procedure could not be found."*

Please, how can I solve that?
fields.summary: [Python] Impossible to import pyarrow module in python. Generates this "ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified procedure could not be found."
fields.environment: Windows 10 PRO, Visual C++ installed, Python 3.8, Miniconda

comments.body: How (pip?, conda?, from conda-forge?) did you install {{pyarrow}}?
[~uwe], I tried using pip and conda-forge but neither worked. It installs pyarrow but it cannot be loaded. I tried in different environments (conda and non-conda) but this error keeps appearing.

[~GitHunter0] you will need to give some more detailed information to be able to help you: for example show the exact steps taken to install pyarrow in some way with the output, how you tested the import and the full error message, the output of {{conda list}} in case of a conda environment (or pip list otherwise), .. 
The output of {{conda info}} could also be useful.
Ok [~jorisvandenbossche] , I will try to gather the information you requested and comeback here soon.

This is the input and output of one of many tries:

[~GitHunter0] thanks for the info!

Regarding the errors you see in Python, those are actually expected: 1) a DataFrame has no "write_feather" method, but it is called "to_feather" (so {{iris.to_feather("iris.feather")}} should work) and 2) the {{pyarrow.feather}} module first needs to be imported specifically before you can use it (eg {{import pyarrow.feather}})

So based on this, it _seems_ that the python installation itself is fine.

[~jorisvandenbossche], hey man, you are right, now it is working good. I still receives the message "ImportError: DLL load failed while importing lib: The specified procedure could not be found." when I try to import the module in R via reticulate using reticulate::import("pyarrow") but it must be an R/reticulate issue.

Thank you!
How did you install R / reticulate / r-arrow ? Normally, if you install those with conda-forge as well, that should work.

[~jorisvandenbossche] I installed R from the official site binary, reticulate from CRAN, and pyarrow from conda forge (I made reticulate use the same miniconda environment I run the tests above, but while it worked using python console, it failed using reticulate, don't know why...)
Other python modules, reticulate imports with no problem
cc [~npr] are there constraints on how pyarrow and R / reticalate need to be installed to be able to talk to each other?
[~GitHunter0] Can you check whether this also happens with Python 3.7? There were some changes regarding dependency loading in 3.8, so this also could be an issue.

I have limited experience here (and zero experience with conda on windows) but I've found that you can't really mix conda and non-conda, and even within conda, if you're using pyarrow and r-arrow, they need to be on the same version because they have to share arrow-cpp. So either go all conda, including R itself, r-arrow, and pyarrow, or don't use conda at all and use a pyarrow wheel in a virtualenv.
Yes [~uwe], I will soon try to install Python 3.7 and get back here
[~npr], it is too bad, that is kind of limiting. I heard something along those lines at other forums but I wish it wasn't true. In any case, thank you for the input.

[~uwe], I tried with Python 3.7.7 and received the same error message:
"Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert) : 
  ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified procedure could not be found."
